explanation:
Include every direct callee of OS_BinSemGetInfo and each function they call (per the static call graph) so the next analyst can determine whether any execution path can return to OS_BinSemGetInfo (directly or indirectly). Specifically:

- OS_BinSemGetInfo_Impl: direct callee; any call from here back to OS_BinSemGetInfo would create indirect recursion.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: called by the Impl; must be checked for calls back to the target.

- OS_ObjectIdGetById: direct callee; it invokes object-id transaction helpers that could call other OS_ functions and potentially the target.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit, OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex, OS_ObjectIdConvertToken, OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel: transitive callees of OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to inspect whether they (or their callees) call OS_BinSemGetInfo.
- OS_ObjectIdRelease: direct callee; it calls transaction finish which might chain into other object APIs.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish: transitive callee of OS_ObjectIdRelease; include for the same reason.

- OS_printf and OS_ConsoleWrite: immediate callees listed; OS_printf is known to call other helpers (including itself) and could, in theory, call into code that eventually calls OS_BinSemGetInfo. Include these to rule out recursion through logging/console paths.

- UT_... and UtAssert_... stubs (UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType, UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData, UT_ExecuteBasicHandler, UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr, UT_GetStubEntry, UT_ClearStubEntry, UT_SetHandlerFunction, UT_DefaultStubImpl, UT_ExecuteVaHandler, UtAssert_Abort, UtAssert_GetContext): these unit-test / stub helper functions are listed as callees of OS_BinSemGetInfo in the graph. Their implementations sometimes call back into OS_ APIs (or set handlers that do), so they must be inspected to ensure no test-stub mediated path returns to OS_BinSemGetInfo.

In short, this set covers all immediate callees and their listed transitive callees from the provided call graph; each must be examined to prove there is no path that leads back to OS_BinSemGetInfo (i.e., no direct or indirect self-call), as required by the MISRA rule.
